test_suite.description: Test questions targeting key weaknesses of naive RAG vs GraphRAG advantages

counting.description: Exact counting queries - impossible for naive RAG, perfect for GraphRAG
questions: How many people have Python programming skills?
How many people have worked at Google?
What is the total number of people with AWS certifications?
How many people have Master's degrees?
How many people are located in San Francisco?
How many people have both Docker and Kubernetes skills?

filtering.description: Multi-criteria filtering - difficult for naive RAG, natural for GraphRAG
questions: List all people who have both React and Node.js skills
Find all developers with more than 5 years of Python experience
Show me people who have AWS certifications and work with cloud technologies
Find all people who studied Computer Science and have industry experience
List people who worked at both startups and large companies
Find all senior developers with leadership experience

aggregation.description: Statistical calculations - impossible for naive RAG, straightforward for GraphRAG
questions: What is the average years of experience across all candidates?
What is the most common programming language skill?
What is the average number of skills per person?
Which city has the most candidates?
What percentage of people have cloud certifications?
What is the most frequently mentioned company?

sorting.description: Ranking and ordering - very difficult for naive RAG, natural for GraphRAG
questions: Who are the top 3 most experienced developers?
List the 5 people with the most programming languages
Rank all candidates by their number of certifications
Who has the most diverse skill set?
List people in order of their career progression
Which candidates have the most company experience?

multi_hop_reasoning.description: Relationship traversal - impossible for naive RAG, core strength of GraphRAG
questions: Find all pairs of people who attended the same university
Which people have worked at the same companies?
Find developers who have complementary skills for a full-stack team
Identify people who could mentor others based on shared skills
Find all connections between people through shared employers
Which people have similar career paths?

temporal_reasoning.description: Date and time-based queries - difficult for naive RAG, natural for GraphRAG
questions: Who graduated most recently?
Find people who started their careers in the same year
Which certifications were obtained in the last 2 years?
Who has the longest tenure at a single company?
Find people who changed careers after 2020
Which candidates have the most recent work experience?
Find Python developers with AWS certifications who studied at top universities
List all senior developers with both frontend and backend skills
Find people with machine learning skills who worked at tech companies
Identify candidates with both technical skills and business experience
Find full-stack developers with startup experience and advanced degrees
List all candidates suitable for a DevOps role based on their skills and experience

metadata.data_source: CV knowledge graph built from PDF resumes
